page.title: 06Farming
page.content: There are 2 farms in Deene;-Home Farm, which is farmed on a partnership basis by Mr Brudenell,Lord of the Manor,and Mr Saunders,winner of the 1983 Grand National.The farm is almost entirely arable,with a few sheep in Deene Park. Manor Farm is a mixed farm with 1100 acres of arable and 700 acres of grass. Because of the large acreage of reclaimed ground (iron-ore quarries)the emphasis at Manor Farm is placed on grazing-with 500 cattle and 700 sheep. There are 150 milking cows on the farm, which calve from Sept. to Christmas. Lambing starts in January and goes on until March.During May and June Silage making takes priority.July until Sept. is harvest time.Three brothers run the Manor Farm, and they employ five other workers.
